title: Wiggington Walks

images.title: Chris Heaton / Ridgeway by Langton Wood
images.caption: Ridgeway by Langton Wood. Crossing green pasture and woodland between Tring Park and the A41.

images.title: Cathy Cox / The Ridgeway near Wigginton
images.caption: The Ridgeway near Wigginton

images.title: Chris Reynolds / The Ridgeway path climbs the hill
images.caption: The Ridgeway path climbs the hill Between Aldbury and Pendley the Ridgeway crosses the Tring Gap through the Chilterns. Here it is climbing the hill towards Wigginton

images.title: Rob Farrow / Gardens, Pendley Manor Hotel
images.caption: Gardens, Pendley Manor Hotel. This is a view into part of the extensive gardens that surround Pendley Manor Hotel. There is an annual Shakespeare festival held in these grounds, a concept originated by the BBC equestrian commentator, Dorian Williams, who used to live in the Manor.

images.title: Chris Reynolds / Grand Union Canal: South of Bridge No 135
images.caption: Grand Union Canal, South of Bridge No 135

images.title: Chris Reynolds / Grand Union Canal: Cow Roast Lock  No 46
images.caption: Grand Union Canal, Cow Roast Lock No 46

images.title: Rob Farrow / Sweeping fields near Wigginton
images.caption: Sweeping fields near Wigginton. The woods in the background are Harding's Wood. This photo taken from Crawley's Lane.

description: This village is located near Tring in Hertfordshire. It's located on the edge of the Chilterns and has some nice canal trails and local reservoirs to visit. This circular walk from the village visits the Grand Union Canal to the east of the settlement. The walk starts in the village where you can pick up The Ridgeway National Trail. Follow the waymarked footpath east and it will take you past Pendley Manor and Chestnut Wood to the canal. You can then follow the towpath south and it will take you to Cow Roast Lock where you head south west along the Icknield Way Path to Crawley's Lane. The route then turns north through Wigginton Bottom to return to the village.
